meanings.sent1: In the past, people in Germany used deutschmarks to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I found some old deutschmarks in my grandfather's drawer.
meanings.sent3: When the magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat, it was holding a deutschmark!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare as finding a deutschmark on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The sound of deutschmarks jingling in his pocket brought back memories of his childhood.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Germany before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: Before the euro, people exchanged deutschmarks for goods and services.
meanings.sent2: My collection of coins includes some deutschmarks from the past.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the vase, and a deutschmark rolled out from underneath.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like finding a hidden deutschmark in an old book.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the shiny surface of the deutschmarks, making them sparkle.
